ï»¿Adhiinistralon Agreement betweer the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Sweden and the International Bak for Reconstruction and Developnnt concerning the Multi-Donor Trust Fundfor the Jordan Emergency Services and Social Resilience Project (No. TF072092) I. The International Bank fo Reconstruction and Development (the "Bank") acknowledges that the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Sw(;den (the "Donor", and together with the Bank, the "Parties" and each a "Party") agrees to provide the sum of forty million Swedish Kronor (SEK 40,000,000) (the "Contribution") for the Multi-Donor Trust Fund :or the Jordan Emergency Services and Social Resilience Project, No. TF072092 (the "Trust Fund") in ac.ordance with the tenns of this Administration Agreement. Other donors are also expected to contribute to if e Trust Fund on the terms and conditions specified in the Annexes to this Administration Agreement. 2. The Contribution shall be used to finance the activities set forth in the "Trust Fund Description" attached hereto as Annex 1, and sh II be administered by the Bank on behalf of the Donor in accordance with the terms of this Administration Ag.cement, including the "Standard Provisions" attached hereto as Annex 2. 3. The Donor shall deposit th Contribution promptly following countersignature in the full amount and currency ("Contribution Currency") specified in Section I above into such bank account designated by the Bank upon submission of a paymer t request by the Bank (such deposit being and "Installment'). 4. When making any depost, the Donor shall instruct its bank to include in its deposit details information (remittance advice) ti1d of its SWIFT deposit message, information indicating: the amount deposited, that the deposit is made by the Donor for TF072092 (the Multi-Donor Trust Fund for the Jordan Emergency Services and Social Re iilience Project), and the date of the deposit (the "Deposit Instructions"). In addition, the Donor shall providt a copy of the Deposit Instructions to the Batik's Accounting Trust Funds Division by e-mail sent to ifremitadvicc@worldbank.org or by fax sent to +1 (202) 614-1315. 5. Except with respect to the Deposit Instructions, any notice, request or other communication to be given or made under this Administ -ation Agreement shall be in writing and delivered by mail, fax or e-mail to the respective Party's address sp zcifed below or at such other address as such Party notifies in writing to the other Party fiom time to time: For the Bank (the "Bank C ntact") Ms. Sima Kanaan Lead Social Deveh pient Specialist MNSSU The World Bank 1818 H St NW Washington, DC 21433 Tel: 202 473 8394 E-mail: skanaan@ vorldbank.org 1
ï»¿For the Donor (the "Donoi Contact"): Ms. Cecilia Wram ;ten Deputy Director Department for M ddle East and North Africa, Ministry for Foreign Affairs Government Offic:s of Sweden, SE-103 39 Stockholm Tel: + 46840 55626 E-mail: -magnueh,l 4iften@gov.se 6. In the event any amounts ire to be returned to the Donor under this Administration Agreement, the Bank shall transfer such amounts to the Donor's applicable donor balance account with the Bank, unless otherwise agreed with the Bank. 7. All annexes hereto constit ite an integral part of this Administration Agreement, whose terms taken together shall constitute the entire agreement and understanding between the Donor and the Bank. Unless otherwise specified in an annex I creto, this Administration Agreement may be amended only by written amendment between the Bank ano I the Donor; provided, however, that any annexes to this Administration Agreement may be amended only by written amendment of all donors contributing to the Trust Fund. 8. Each of the Parties repres ints, by confirming its agreement below, that it is authorized to enter into this Administration Agreement aid act in accordance with these terms and conditions. The Parties are requested to sign and date this A Iministration Agreement, and upoh possession by the Bank of this fully signed Administration Agreement this Administration Agreement shall become effective as of the date of the last signature. INTERNATIONAL BANK FOR RECONSTRUCTION AND DEVELOPMENT Date: C THE MINISTRY ,! AFFAIRS OF SWEDEN By: Nan,e: awe~vw kvaLL C-?' Title: Date: 2-,// 2of 2
ï»¿ANNEX I Multi-Donor Trust Fund fir the Jordan Emergency Services and Social Resilience Projoct Trust Fund Description This Annex shall be applicable to and form an integral part of all administration agreements for the Trust Fund (collectively, the "Administra tion Agreements" and each an "Administration Agreement") between the Bank and any entities that provide ny funds to the Trust Fund (collectively, the "Donors"). 1. Objectives The objective of the Trust Fund is to help Jordanian municipalities and host communities address the immediate service delivery impact: of Syrian refugee inflows and strengthen municipal capacity to support local economic development, 2. Activities The activities (which may be described as "components" of activities) to be financed by the Trust Fund aro: 2.1 Bank-executed activities, fir which the Bank has implementation responsibility: (a) Carrying out supervisio i and implementation support of the project. 2.2 Recipient-executed activit es, for which one or more Recipients (as defined in Annex 2) have implementation responsibility: (a) Municipal Grants Provision of municipal gn nts to participating municipalities for carrying out specific development activities (subprojects) fo:using on: (a) sectors within their competence including solid waste management, roads and in nor infrastructure rehabilitation, street lighting, pest control, recreational facilities, social assistance; and (b) other sectors namely water supply and sanitation and waste water management, which are LItside their competence, in collaboration with relevant entities with statutory mandates for thes: sectors. (b) Institutional Developmint and Proiect Management (1) Provision of technical assistance to participating municipalities to plan, implement and manage subprojects including c;rrying our service delivery needs assessments, preparation and implementation of subproj ects, preparation of local economic development plans, as well as project coordination, management and oversight. (2) Carrying out a progr an of activities designed to foster institutional development for crises resilience and emergency Ireparedness, such a program to include such activities as: (i) carrying out initial assessment of eirergency preparedness and risk management systems in Jordan; (ii) preparation and operation ilization of emergency preparedness plans, training of communities and public officials, as well as establishment of risk management protocols and systems; and (iii) carrying out strategic cm 1munication and information sharing activities for the purpose of strengthening crises resilie ice and emergency preparedness among key stakeholders. 3
ï»¿3. Elialble Exvcnditures 3.1 For Bank-executed activit es, the Trust Fund thnds may be used to finance: (a) staff costs - with indirect costs; (b) consultant fees, i idividuals and firms; (c) extended term consultants; (d) temporary support staff costs; (c) Iravel expenses; (f) nedia, workshop, conference, and meeting; and(g) associated overheads. 3.2 For Recipient-executed activities, the Trust Fund funds may be used to fnance eligible expenditures in accordance with the Bank's app icabl policies and procedures. 4. T[xes The foregoing activities and categc ties of expenditures may include the financing of taxes in accordance with the Bank's applicable policies and >rocedures. 4
ï»¿ANNEX 2 Standard Provisions This Annex shall be applicable to and form an integral part of all Administration Agreements between the Bank and the respective Donors. 1. Administration of the Co tribulions 1.1 The Bank shall be respoi sible only for performing those functions specifically set forth in this Administration Agreement and shill not be subject to any other duties or responsibilities to the Donors, including, wilbout limitation, any luties or obligations that might otherwise apply to a fiduciary or trustee under general principles of trust 3r fiduciary law. Nothing in this Administration Agreement shall be considered a waiver of any priviltges or immunities of the Bank tinder its Articles of Agreement or any applicable law, all of which are exj ressly reserved. 1.2 Each Donor's Contributioi i (collectively, the "Contributions") shall be administered in accordance with the Bank's applicable policies and procedures, as the same may be amended from tine to time, including its procurement, financial management, disbursement and safeguard policies, its framework to prevent and combat fraud and corn ption and its screening procedures to prevent the use of Bank resources to finance terrorist activity, in line w ith the Bank's obligations to give effect to the relevant decisions of the Security Council taken under Chap:er VII of the of Charter of the United Nations. The Donors acknowledge that this provision does not create any obligations of the Bank under the anti-terrorist financing and asset control laws, regulations, rules an I executive orders of an individual member country that may apply to a Donor. 2. Mangenient of the Cont ibutions 2.1 The funds deposited in the Trust Fund shall be accounted for as a single trust fund and shall be kept separate and apart from the funds if the Bank. The funds deposited in the Trust Fund may be commingled with other trust fund assets rnaintai ied by the Bank. The Bank, in its capacity as trustee, has legal title to the funds deposited in the Trust Fund. 2.2 The currency in which the 7unds in the Trust Fund shall be held is United States Dollar (the "Holding Currency"). 2.3 Donors agree to deposit 11 cir Contributions in the Contribution Currency stated in their respective Administration Agreements, In t ie case of deposits received in a Contribution Currency other than the Holding Currency, promptly upon the receipt of such amounts and the accompanying Deposit Instructions, the Bank shall convert such amour Is into the Holding Currency at the exchange rate obtained by the Bank on the date of the conversion. Whe -c deposits prove to be insufficient to complete activities as a result of exchange rate fluctuations, neithe the Bank nor the Donor shall bear any responsibility for providing any additional financing. 24 The funds deposited in the Trust Fund may be freely exchanged by the Bank into other currencies as may facilitate their disbursement a the exchange rate obtained by the Bank on the date of the conversion. 2.5 The Bank shall invest and reinvest the funds deposited in the Trust Fund pending their disbursement in accordance with the Bank's ipplicable policies and procedures for the investment of trust fands 5
ï»¿administered by the Bank. The B ank shall credit all income from such investment to the Trust Fund to be used for the sanic purposes as the Contributions. 3. Trust Fund Fees and Co! Is 3.1 The Batik may recover its costs from Donors other than the Bank and, following the deposit of any Installment by such other Donors, deduct and retain for the Bank's own account, as a deduction from each Installment, an amount equal to tw 3 percent (2%) per Installment as an administrative fee for the Trust Fund. 3.2 In addition, costs incurre< by the Bank for other expenses, such as for program management and Trust Fund administration, that i re (i) not covered by the percentage deduction specified above as an administrative fee and (ii) not inc rded under Annex I of the Administration Agreements in accordance with the Bank's applicable policies anc procedures shall be charged to the Trust Fund on an actual basis up to a maximum of zero point three ni ie percent (0.39%) of the total Contributions under all Administration Agreements. 3.3 Each Donor acknowledge, and agrees that the percentage deductions for fees in this Trust Fund 7ees and Costs section are estimatec on the basis of anticipated Contributions. If actual Contributions significantly differ from what war originally anticipated at the time of signature of the first Administration Agreement, or if other circumstan es affecting Trust Fund fees or costs change, the Bank reserves the right to request a change to the terms 6f this Trust Fund Fees and Costs section, which would be effectuated by amendments made to the Admilnis ration Agreements of all Donors and which would thereafter be applicable to all new Contributions that are provided either as amendments to supplement existing Administration Agreements or from new Donors L nder new Administration Agreements. 4. Accounting and Financial Reporting 4.1 The Bank shall maintain s.-parate records and lcdger accounts in respect of the funds depogited in the Trust Fund and disbursements mna<e therefrom. 4.2 The Bank shall furnish to he Donors current financial information relating to receipts, disbursements and fund balance in the Holding Currency with respect to the Contributions via the World Bank's Trust Funds Donor Center secure webs te. Within six (6) months after all commitments and liabilities under the Trust Fund have been satisfied an the Trust Fund has been closed, the final financial information relating to receipts, disbursements and fund I,alance in the Holding Currency with respect to the Contributions shall be made available to the Donors via t ie World Bank's Trust Funds Donor Center secure website. 4.3 The Bank shall provide to the Donors via the World Bank's Trust Fund Donor Center secure website, within six (6) months fc itowing the end of each Bank fiscal year, an annual single audit report, comprising (i) a management a! sertion together with an attestation from the Bank's external auditors concerning the adequacy of intern t control over cash-based financial reporting for all cash-based trust funds as a whole; and (iR) a combined I inancial statement for all cash-based trust funds together with the Bank's external auditor's opinion thereon The cost of the single audit shall be borne by the Bank. 4.4 If a Donor wishes to rec nest, on an exceptional basis, a financial statement audit by the Bank's external auditors of the Trust Fun 1, the Donor and the Bank shall first consult as to whelher such an external audit is necessary. The Bank anc the Donor shall agree on the appropriate scope and terms of reference of such audit. Following agreciner t on the scope and terms of reference, the Bank shall arrange for such external audit. The costs of any such audit, including the internal costs of the Bank with respect to such audit, shall be borne by the requesting Donor. 6
ï»¿4.5 The Bank shall make avail, ble to the Donors copies of all financial statements and auditors' reports received by the Bank from Recipie its pursuant to any Grant Agreements (as defined below) in accordance with the Bank's Access to Informat on Policy. 5. Progress Reporting 5.1 The Bank shall provide the Donors with annual reports on the progress of activities financed by the Contributions. Within six (6) moliths of the End Disbursement Date (as defined below), the Bank shall furnish to the Donors a final report in the activities financed by the Trust Fund. 5.2 Any Donor may review or evaluate activities financed by the Trust Fund at any time up to six (6) months following the End Disbur ement Date. The Donor and the Bank shall agree on the scope and conduct of such review or evaluatic i, and the Bank shall provide all relevant information within the limits of the Bank's applicable policies and procedures. All associated costs, including any costs incurred by the Bank, shall be borne by the Donor, It is understood that any such review or evaluation will not constitute a financial, compliance or other audit of the Trust Fund. 6. Disbursement: Cancellati on; Refund 6.1 It is expected that the fun Is deposited in the Trust Fund will be fully disbursed by the Bank by June 30, 2017 (the "End Disburser tent Date"). The Bank shall only disburse funds deposited in the Trust Fund for the purposes of this Admi istration Agreement (other than returns to Donors) after such date to the extent such date is changed in acc -rdance with amendments made to the Administration Agreements of all the Donors. Following the End DisxUrsement Date, the Bank shall return any remaining balance of the Trust Fund to each Donor in the Hold ng Currency in the manner specified in its respective Administration Agreement on a pro rata basis wi'h regard to the total funds deposited in the Trust Fund by such Donor relative to the total funds depositt d in the Trust Fund by all Donors, all calculated as Holding Currency anmountS. 6.2 Any Donor may cancel all ir part of such Donor's p rL& share, and the Bank may cancel all or any Donors' pro rata shares, upon thret (3) months' prior written notice, of any Contributions (paid and not yet paid) that are not committed pursui,nt to any agreements entered into between the Bank and any consultants and/or other third parties for I1a purposes of this Administration Agreement, including any Grant Agreements, prior to the receipt oi such notice. In the event of a cancellation, the Batik shall return to the Donor its pro rata share in the Folding Currency as specified in the Administration Agreement; unless otherwise agreed between the Bank and the Donor. 7
ï»¿7. Disclosure: Dispute Resol itioa 7.1 The Bank shall disclose th, Administration Agreements ind related infornation on this Trust Fund in accordance with the Bank's Policy on Access to Information. By entering into Administration Agreements, the Donors consent k such disclosure of their respective Administration Agreements and such related information. 7.2 The Donors and the Bank ;hall use their best efforts to amicably settle any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to tl e Administration Agreements. 8. Grants to Recipients 8.1 The Bank shall, as admini trator of the Trust Fund on behalf of the Donors, enter into one or more grant agreements (the "Grant AgreArments") with recipients (the "Recipients") consistent wiih the purposes of this Administration Agreement an I on the terms and conditions set forth in the Grant Agreements. Grant Agreements may be entered into ul to the maximum amount of the Contributions that all Donors have agreed to make available under the Admin stration Agreements between the Bank and the Donors. 8.2 The Bank shall be respe isible for the supervision of the activities financed under any Grant Agreements. Subject to the coriser t of any relevant Recipients, representatives of the Donors may be invited by the Bank to participate in Batik mpervision missions related to the Trust Fund. 8.3 The Bank shall promptly ii,form the Donors of any significant modification to the terms of any Grant Agreements and of any contractu: I remedies that are exercised by the Bank under any Grant Agreements. To the extent practicable, the Bi nk shall afford the Donors the opportunity to exchange views before effecting any such modification or exercising any such remedy. 8
